metadata.title: CVE-2022-1292 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: The c_rehash script does not properly sanitise shell metacharacters toprevent command injection. This script is distributed by some operatingsystems in a manner where it is automatically executed. On such operatingsystems, an attacker could execute arbitrary commands with the privilegesof the script. Use of the c_rehash script is considered obsolete and shouldbe replaced by the OpenSSL rehash command line tool. Fixed in OpenSSL 3.0.3(Affected 3.0.0,3.0.1,3.0.2). Fixed in OpenSSL 1.1.1o (Affected1.1.1-1.1.1n). Fixed in OpenSSL 1.0.2ze (Affected 1.0.2-1.0.2zd).

criterions.comment: openssl package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
edk2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
